div.p: Friendly arguing about a football game) NARRATOR: Let's see how that same game-watch might have played out if one of the guys was in the Yellow Phase.
NARRATOR: People in the Yellow Phase begin to really enjoy high-risk choices, and feeling shifts from "take-it-or-leave-it" to "anticipation."
TRAVIS: Hey Miguel! There's some food over there, and there's a beer in the fridge.
MIGUEL: Don't worry, I came prepared! You got room for these?
NARRATOR: When a person in the Yellow Phase gets together to watch a game, or hang out with friends, they look forward to the drinking or drugs about as much as they look forward to the event.

NARRATOR: It's now an important part of their social life, and doing these things without the alcohol or drugs doesn't see like as much fun because drinking isn't just a part of a good time, it's the way to a good time.
NARRATOR: In the Yellow Phase, alcohol and drugs are often a central part of a person's social life and relationships.
NARRATOR: They believe it makes fun possible. This attitude makes drinking or drug use more important to them, so they are more likely to drink or use more.
